intro: Hedyotis fluviatilis var. kamapuaana, commonly known as the Kama'āpuaʻa, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest understories. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
